answers.text: the series of revolutions in Russia in 1917, which destroyed the Tsarist autocracy and led to the creation of the Soviet Union.

qas.question: What happened when Nicholas II was removed from power?

answers.text: the Russian Provisional Government was established.

qas.question: What event happened in October of 1917?
What happened during the red faction revolution?

answers.text: armed groups of workers and deserting soldiers directed by the Bolshevik Party, seized control of Saint Petersburg

context: The Russian Revolution is <a0_0>the series of revolutions in Russia in 1917, which destroyed the Tsarist autocracy and led to the creation of the Soviet Union.<a0_0/> Following the abdication of Nicholas II of Russia, <a1_0>the Russian Provisional Government was established.<a1_0/> In October 1917, <a2_0>a red faction revolution<a2_0/> occurred in which the Red Guard, <a3_0>armed groups of workers and deserting soldiers directed by the Bolshevik Party, seized control of Saint Petersburg<a3_0/> (then known as Petrograd) and began an immediate armed takeover of cities and villages throughout the former Russian Empire.
